intro: Sideroxylon inerme subsp. diospyroides, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits that are edible for some bird species. It is often found in dry forests and woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
